text:
We'll show you how to
uninstall apps on your Mac
in a couple different ways:
using the Launchpad and your Finder.
Click Launchpad in the dock
or open it from your applications folder.
Press and hold the option key

or click and hold any app
until the apps jiggle.

Click the X next to the
app you want to delete,
then click "Delete" to confirm.
You can also move the app to the trash.
You can drag the app to the trash,
and it will prompt you to delete it.
Another method is to use your Finder.
Open Finder and search for the app
in the applications folder.

Now select the app and
drag it to the trash icon.

Open trash and click "Empty"
in the top right corner.
You can also right-click on the app
and choose "Move to Trash."
Then empty the trash.
